intro: Styphelia dealbata, commonly known as the white-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heather. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Styphelia dealbata typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in coastal heathlands. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
